revised_title: Osmotic Pressure of Hemoglobin in Salt-Free Solutions
tldr: The osmotic pressure of hemoglobin in salt-free solutions was studied. Previous experiments had varying results due to the presence of combined acids or bases. The author found that when using iso-electric hemoglobin, the osmotic pressure was lower, and higher pressures were obtained when conductivity and hydrogen-ion determinations showed the presence of acid or base. The molecular weight of pure hemoglobin is about four times the equivalent.
